intro: Hieracium craspedon, commonly known as the rough hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grasslands. Hieracium craspedon is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and environmental conditions.
